The Elder’s Birth Story about Giving a Handful of Grass
“Not far from the Himalayas,
there is a mountain named Lambaka;
Right there the Three-Insight Buddha,
was walking in the open air.
In the past I was a hunter,
in the forest, in the jungle;

analyzed: disvāna tam devadeva  tiṇa muṭṭhi madāsaha
translated: Having seen that God of Gods,🔽I gave a handful of grass.
For the Buddha’s sitting place,
having given, I delighted in the mind;
Having worshipped the Buddha,
I departed facing north.
Not long after I had gone,
the king of beasts attacked me;
Having been struck down by the lion,
I died right there.
The deed I did near to the Buddha,
the best of Buddhas, the unsullied one,
was well released like a flood,
and I went to the world of the gods.
There was a beautiful sacrificial post,
made by the power of my meritorious deeds;
With a thousand sections, a hundred panels,
with flags, made of green (jade).
The light shone from it,

analyzed: sa tarasi iva u k gataḥ
translated: like a hundred lightning bolts risen up;
Filled with celestial maidens,
I enjoyed sensual pleasures.
Having fallen from the world of the gods,
I was accused with a false accusation,
But having returned to human status,
I attained the destruction of the pollutants.
For ninety-four eons
I gave a seat,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the handful of grass.
My defilements are burned away,
all my existences are destroyed;
Like an elephant who has broken his bonds,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed it was for me
in the presence of the Buddha;
The three knowledges have been attained,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations as well,
The six direct knowledges have been realized,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the elder Tiṇamuṭṭhidāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tiṇamuṭṭhidāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Tiṇamuṭṭhidāyakattherassāpadānaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
